briefTitle: Long-Term Safety and Efficacy Study of Avanafil in Men With Erectile Dysfunction

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Percentage of Sexual Attempts in Which Subjects Were Able to Maintain an Erection of Sufficient Duration to Have Successful Intercourse.
outcomeMeasures.description: Data presented as mean change from baseline and the treatment period in the percentage of Yes responses to Sexual Encounter Profile (SEP) diary question 3 "Did your erection last long enough for you to have successful intercourse?" Baseline is the run-in period from the qualifying study (TA-301/TA-302) consisting of all data reported during the non-treatment interval from Visit 1 to Visit 2. The treatment period is the on-treatment interval beginning with the first dose of study drug and ending on the last study visit.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Percentage of Sexual Attempts in Which Subjects Were Able to Insert the Penis Into the Partner's Vagina
outcomeMeasures.description: Data presented as mean change from baseline and the treatment period in the percentage of Yes responses to Sexual Encounter Profile (SEP) diary question 2 "Were you able to insert your penis into your partner's vagina?" Baseline is the run-in period from the qualifying study (TA-301/TA-302) consisting of all data reported during the non-treatment interval from Visit 1 to Visit 2. The treatment period is the on-treatment interval beginning with the first dose of study drug and ending on the last study visit.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in International Index of Erectile Function - Erectile Function Domain (IIEF-EF) Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Questionnaire assesses subject's evaluation of erectile function over the previous 4-week period. Total score from questions 1-5 \& 15 ranges from 1 to 30. A higher score indicates better erectile function. Baseline is the observation at Visit 2 of the qualifying study (TA-301/TA-302). End of treatment is the observation at Visit 8 of the last observation carried forward.
